messages.text: update this to align the canvases to the right of the test text, and make it look good even if the tests are nested

Okay, I will update the CSS rules for `#mocha .test`, `#mocha .test h2`, and `#mocha .test canvas` in `index.html` to align the canvas to the right of the test title (`h2`) within each test container. This involves changing the flex direction to `row`, adjusting alignment, and modifying how the text and canvas share space.

OK, I've updated the styles in `index.html`.

I changed the `#mocha .test` container to use `flex-direction: row` and `align-items: center`, added a `gap` for spacing.
The `#mocha .test h2` now uses `flex: 1` to take up the available horizontal space.
The `#mocha .test canvas` has a fixed size (`150px` x `150px`) and `flex-shrink: 0` to prevent it from shrinking.

This should place the canvas to the right of the test title and maintain a consistent layout.
